<JD_START>
Job Title: Sr. Financial Analyst

Location: Atlanta, GA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Finance, Sales

Description:
This position reports to a Sr. Manager, Brand Finance, and will partner with the brand management, sales planning, and operations finance teams to drive profitable growth for the business. This role will be responsible for sales & profitability forecasting and reporting & analysis of brand financial results. The role will also support each brand’s long-term strategic plan, select product pricing, and coordination of deal approvals. The ability to effectively work across multiple business functions is critical to the success of this position.

Specific Responsibilities

Prepare forecasts and analysis of Net Sales and Product Margin partnering with Brand and Sales teams to help bridge Demand Plan to Forecast.Review proposed promotional activities and give recommendations based on Segment strategic and financial goals. Develop reporting and analytics of product/customer profitability to support the brand management organization and portfolio management initiatives.Support new product development financial modeling.Assist in the preparation of the annual sales plan and long-term strategic plan.Assist with month-end and quarter-end close activities including variance commentary and reporting.Ability to manage multiple priorities, as the timeline to action may be tight and require significant cross-functional coordination.Strong business acumen and ability to share business knowledge with non-financial individuals.Ad hoc projects as assigned.

Key Qualifications

Strong analytical skills.Undergraduate degree in Accounting, Finance, or Business.3 – 5 years of relevant finance experience, preferably in Consumer-Packaged Goods (CPG)Proficiency in MS Office applications (Access, Word, Excel, PowerPoint, etc.), computer literate. Experience with SAP and Oracle/Hyperion planning systems is strongly preferred.Excellent oral and written communication skills.Self-motivated in achieving goals and completing routine tasks.Ability to work as part of a team and interface with others across all levels of the organization.

_Newell Brands (NASDAQ: NWL) is a leading global consumer goods company with a strong portfolio of well-known brands, including Rubbermaid, Sharpie, Graco, Coleman, Rubbermaid Commercial Products, Yankee Candle, Paper Mate, FoodSaver, Dymo, EXPO, Elmer’s, Oster, NUK, Spontex and Campingaz. We are focused on delighting consumers by lighting up everyday moments. Newell Brands and its subsidiaries are Equal Opportunity Employers and comply with applicable employment laws. EOE/M/F/Vet/Disabled are encouraged to apply.

Experience Level (if available): Mid-Senior level
<JD_END>
